page.title: 12Pye Corner Farm
page.content: The{oldest title deed}of Pye corner farm goes back to{1702}where it was sold for{Â£11.}It wasn't very big then. Mrs Hodder, who is the owner of Pye Corner Farm has{three workers}not counting herself and one that comes in when he is needed. She has{240 acres of land, 120 in Odcombe the rest is in East Chinnock. She has about{25 {fields,}the biggest is 22 acres. Wheat is grown on 94 acres, barley on 25, peas on 24, potatoes on 7 acres, grass on 100 and the rest is woods and ponds etc. The animals she has are{85 beef animals, and she looks after{2 to 3 {hundred hens}which belong to Nik, one of her workers. It was an{inn}in about 1700 and lasted as an inn for a hundred years. They changed it into a farm because there was lots of land around,and it was not a very grand inn.
